IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ELIJA FARM IS COMMITTED TO USING ENVIRONMENTALLY RESPONSIBLE PRACTICES TO RAISE HIGH QUALITY, ORGANICALLY GROWN PRODUCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ELIJA FARM IS COMMITTED TO USING ENVIRONMENTALLY RESPONSIBLE PRACTICES TO RAISE HIGH QUALITY, ORGANICALLY GROWN PRODUCE.
IRS990.Desc: THE ELIJA FARM COMMUNITY SUPPORTED AGRICULTURE ("CSA") PROGRAM IS DEDICATED TO ENRICHING THE HEALTH AND WELLNESS OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH DYNAMIC LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO ITS DIVERSE MEMBERSHIP. THIS CSA PROGRAM ALLOWS LOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO PURCHASE A SHARE OF THE FARM'S CROPS PRIOR TO EACH GROWING SEASON. THE ELIJA FARM'S MISSION IS TO USE ENVIRONMENTALLY RESPONSIBLE PRACTICES TO RAISE HIGH QUALITY, ORGANICALLY GROWN PRODUCE, WHILE PROVIDING MEANINGFUL TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED INDIVIDUALS. ELIJA FARM'S MODEL ALLOWS YOUNG PEOPLE WITH AUTISM TO REAP THE BENEFITS OF TENDING THE FARM, WHILE ALSO ACQUIRING RELEVANT BUSINESS SKILLS ASSOCIATED WITH SELLING PRODUCE AND MANAGING THE CSAS PROGRAM.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: OPERATING LEASE RIGHT OF USE ASSETS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION FILES AN IRS FORM 990 AND RESPECTIVE STATE AND LOCAL TAX RETURNS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS DETERMINED THAT IT HAS REGISTERED IN ALL STATES WHERE IT IS REQUIRED TO BE REGISTERED. THE ORGANIZATION EVALUATED ITS ACTIVITIES FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AND HAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022.
THE BOARD REVIEWS SALARIES OF TOP OFFICIALS FROM OTHER COMPARABLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THEY THEN DISCUSS COMPENSATION PACKAGES AND VOTE ON WHETHER OR NOT TO APPROVE.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE TOWN OF HUNTINGTON LOCAL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO PURCHASE FARMLAND AND ACCOMPANYING BUILDING

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD IS PROVIDED WITH A COPY OF THE 990 BY THE CFO. THE BOARD REVIEWS THE 990 AND PROVIDES ANY QUESTIONS OR COMMENTS TO THE CFO. ONCE THE PROCESS IS COMPLETE, THE 990 IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD DISCUSSES ANNUALLY IF THERE ARE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND VOTES ON WHETHER OR NOT TO ACCEPT THEM. THE INDIVIDUAL WHO HAS THE CONFLICT IS RECUSED FROM THE MEETING WITH THE DISINTERESTED BOARD MEMBERS RATIFYING THE CONFLICTED TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD REVIEWS SALARIES OF TOP OFFICIALS FROM OTHER COMPARABLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THEY THEN DISCUSS COMPENSATION PACKAGES AND VOTE ON WHETHER OR NOT TO APPROVE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PUBLIC CAN CALL THE ORGANIZATION TO REQUEST COPIES OF THESE DOCUMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE 990 IS POSTED ON GUIDESTAR.ORG AND THE NY STATE CHARITIES BUREAU WEBSITE.
